comment: Literally one of the best teachers I have had so far. She is really funny and brings a therapy dog in for the final so I highly recommend for her and the cute dog.

She is very excited about teaching and you can tell she cares about her students. The guest speakers were very interesting but some of the group activities were kind of useless. Gives lots of homework but they are all an easy A. Felt more like a high school class than a college one. Would take her again though.

Professor Dresdner is VERY passionate about her job. She does not want you to fail so she does her best to help everyone pass. We had mostly in class group projects or small individual projects that we got like 2 weeks to complete. She understands that we have other classes, so if you just try a little in her class, you will basically get an A.

Ms. Dresdner is the most caring teacher ever! If I ever missed one of her classes I would be so upset because coming to her class made my day. In and out class group projects and we only had one real quiz. The textbook was used to study for the quiz but it was easy so there's no need to buy the textbook. Honestly everyone needs to take her class.

Professor Dresdner is extremely passionate about freshman seminar and she clearly loves what she does. Her class is filled with busy work but it's very easy and manageable to do. She's a very sweet person and she will definitely make you feel welcome and appreciated as an individual. All she wants is for you to succeed at KSU and in life!

Professor Dresdner is extremely passionate about freshman seminar and she clearly loves what she does. Her class is filled with busy work but it's very easy and manageable to do. She's a very sweet person and she will definitely make you feel welcome and appreciated as an individual. All she wants is for you to succeed in school and in life!

KSU seminar is dumb but it wasn't the worst with her. She is very kind and funny but the class is a joke. She will say you need the textbook, YOU DO NOT. DON'T BUY IT. Lots of homework and projects but very easy and usually group assigned. I highly recommend her.
Really good teacher, very energetic. There are a lot of projects but mostly group ones, not hard at all. Test were not hard just pay attention. And just show up and you'll pass.

Professor Dresdner is super sweet and caring. She really makes an effort to help out her students. She doesn't lecture all day and instead invites speakers to speak on the topic. She's very energetic, so there is never a boring day of class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She's a very sweet lady, for me it was a little much for an 8am. Very peppy and veryyyy extra... makes the class a little more involved than just a freshman seminar, but you're basically guaranteed to get an A if you show up. Just expect lots of group projects and something due basically every class.

I loved her. She reminded me of my high school teachers. For a freshman seminar class, she does so well. She really cares about each student and wants everyone to get to know each other. She makes you feel very welcome at KSU. If you don't like peppy people in the morning then don't take her, but I thought she was awesome.

Dresdner is an easy A if you do the work. Even if you write an essay at only half the length she asked for, you'll still probably get an A or a B. Shes very friendly and obviously cares about students. Only problem is that many of her assignments are useless and take too long but I guess that's just KSU seminar classes as a whole.

Favorite teacher I've had at KSU. I was a bit introverted my first semester and she helped me come out of my shell. Expect to have 45 minutes worth of homework a week which are usually just a reading with a response. She makes study guides for each test so they are a joke. TAKE HER.

Professor Dreadsner was amazing! She has an energy that you would love and cares about all of her students.  She made the class interesting and worth taking. Although not big on attendance, it is expected.

Professor Dresdner is so sweet and made this class actually bearable and interesting. She brings guest speakers who are actually interesting to listen to. She makes you write a short paper or do some small assignment for everything learned in class but she grades super easy;just act like you care and you will get an A. I highly suggest taking her!

Mrs. Dresdner took a class that had little meaning and made it feel worth it. She is fun, quirky, and has a heart of gold. She really seems to care about her students. Most of her assignments are personal writings, but as long as you show her you care you'll get a good grade. I definitely recommend her

She is extremely nice and cheerful. She does not lecture. She assigns readings and then in class you do group projects or activities. Some of her assignments are a little much, but they are easy. If you do the work, you most likely will get a 100 on the assignments. She genuinely cares for students. Also, there are guest speakers

Ms. Dresdner is very sweet and caring! She does do a lot of projects, but basically hands everyone a 100. Her tests are a little skewed from the study guide but always has HUGE curves. You're basically guaranteed an A. She can be very peppy and she can get off topic but her grading scale is so easy and I've never made below an A on something.
She's loopy but it's not a hard class. Group projects on a weekly basis but good classroom atmosphere.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I had prof. Dresdner my first semester at KSU, and she was absolutely fantastic! The tests we had were pretty straight forward and easy as long as you at least skimmed the book. Lots of fun group work so you make some good friends. Very personable and helpful professor, who you could build a relationship with. 10/10 would take again

She is an awesome teacher and wants the best from you. She encourages you to do your best and Freshmen Seminar is very fun. She should also be a English teacher because she knows a lot and explains everything for you. I love this teacher and she is awesome. Take her!
She's like a 5th grade teacher- really excited, really active, and always happy. She uses simple means to explain everything. She isn't very hard but wants you to be active in class.
